alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 10:34PM CDT until July 05 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN MILWAUKEE COUNTY... At 1034 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated persistent thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing but is gradually diminishing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Milwaukee, Greenfield, Oak Creek, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Greendale, St. Francis and Franklin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
